intro: Tetrapterys inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal-leaf tetrapterys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
